headline: Chief Executive Resigns at United Technologies
snippet: Louis R. Chenevert steered the aerospace and building systems giant’s $18.4 billion purchase of the aerospace parts maker Goodrich in 2012....

headline: United Technologies Picks Retiree to Lead Copter Unit
snippet: United appointed Robert Leduc, president of Sikorsky, to the new role of United’s senior vice president for strategic projects....

headline: United Technologies Plans to Sell or Spin Off Sikorsky Unit
snippet: A decision on the fate of the 90-year-old company, which makes Black Hawk helicopters, is expected by the end of the third quarter....

headline: Weak Earnings Send Market Sliding Downward
snippet: Stocks veered lower in afternoon trading, weighed down by weak results from IBM, United Technologies and other companies. Telecom stocks were among the biggest decliners....

headline: United Technologies Declines Renewed Offer From Honeywell
snippet: The impasse between the two has halted, at least for now, the creation of what would be a nearly $150 billion industrial giant....

headline: Honeywell and United Technologies Disagree on Merits of Merger
snippet: Analysts appear to have concluded that putting the two companies together poses at least some antitrust risk....

headline: Honeywell Persists in Pursuit of United Technologies
snippet: United Technologies responded to Honeywell’s latest bid with a presentation outlining its concerns about antitrust problems....

headline: Honeywell, Facing Resistance, Drops Bid for United Technologies
snippet: Honeywell said it was withdrawing its $90 billion takeover offer after its rival steadfastly argued that a union would be blocked by regulators....

headline: United Technologies’ Deal for Rockwell Collins Faces Skepticism
snippet: Investors and customers like Boeing and Airbus questioned the benefits of uniting the two big airplane parts makers.

headline: United Technologies Makes an Expensive Purchase to Gain Scale
snippet: The combination with Rockwell Collins makes strategic sense, but revenue benefits or a lucrative breakup may be needed to prove the deal’s potential.

headline: United Technologies to Buy Rockwell Collins in $30 Billion Deal
snippet: United Technologies, the corporate parent of Pratt & Whitney, will pay $140 a share in cash and stock in one of the largest deals in aerospace history.
